result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik M Garner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,512.00 payable to Chanita S. or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during Extended Supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
AS TO ALL COURT COSTS, FEES, SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
06-09-2016/ Judge Ellen R Brostrom
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended by commuting the term of extended supervision on count one to five years

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that becuase he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within five years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory three (3) year Initial Confinement.

ORDER AMENDED JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION, signed and filed. lms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Ellen R. Brostrom, Br. 6, for review. spc
Letter from DOC reqeusting review of sentence.
WITNESS LIST, STATE.  FILED
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by:  James G. and Diean P.

COUNT 1 - CONSECUTIVE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS, with credit for 752 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 7 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

AMENDED COUNT 2 - CONSECUTIVE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 21 YEARS, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 9 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Restitution payable to Chanita S. for $1,512.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during extended supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

At the hour of 4:11pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to Count 2 lesser included first degree reckless homicide, as a party to a crime, in violation of 940.02(1), which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Per motion of State Court dismiss while armed enhancer.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Case is adjourned for sentencing no PSI ordered.

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury in the box at 10:16 a.m.  Transcript of requested testimony read to the jury.  Jury out of the box at 10:19 a.m.  Jury retired to continue deliberations.  On the same day at the hour of 4:28 p.m. the jury returned and by the Foreperson brought in a verdict that was then and there read by the Court.
-We, the Jury, find the Defendant Guilty of First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, in manner and form as charged in Count #1 of the Information.
If you find the defendant guilty, you must answer the following question: "Did the defendant commit the crime of First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety while using a dangerous weapon?" Yes
AS TO COUNT 2: The jury was hung.
Court polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed. Court discharged the jury.  Court withholds ruling on Defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict pending motions after verdict. State motion for judgment on the verdict granted by the Court pending motions after verdict.  Exhibit list, in writing, received and filed.  Case adjourned to 6-26-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for scheduling conference Branch 10.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial resumed. Jury in box at the hour of 1:20pm. Closing arguments by state and defense. Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:53pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Adam and Do who were duly sworn for that purpose.  

Juror question received and filed at 4:16pm.

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury trial resumed. Jury in box at the hour of  9:52am. Sworn for the State: Chief Medical Examiner Brain Peterson, and citizen witness Terry C. Exbitbit 148 published to the jury and received into evidence. State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury out of box at 10:52am. Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify. Waiver of right to testify form received and filed. Discussion of jury instructions with the parties in chambers and then on the record. Jury in box at 11:24am. Defense rests. Testimony closed.  Court instructed the jury. Jurors excused for the morning. Jury out of the box at the hour of 11:50am. Court ordered case adjourned for continuation of jury trial at 1:15pm on 06/11/2015 in Branch 10.

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial resumed. Jury back in the box at the hour of 1:32pm. Testimony continued from previously sworn State's witness, citizen witness, Charles D. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Forensic Investigator Chet St. Clair, citizen witness Quiton P.. Jury out of box at 2:56pm. Jury back in box at 3:27pm. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Timothy Graham, Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory Forensic Scientist Nicole Hinton, Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory Firearms and Toolmark Examiner Mark Simonson. Exhibit 24, 30b, 51, 67, 72, 73, 139, 147, 201 (only portion read), and 203 (only portion read)  received. Court instructed the jury. Jurors excused for the day. Jury out of box at 4:33pm Sidebars placed on the record. Case adjourned for continuation of jury trial on 06/11/2015 at 9:30am in Branch 10. Case adjourned to Branch 10.

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial resumed.  Jury in the box at the hour of 9:51am. Sworn for the state: Citizen witness Charles D. A portion of exhibit 75 published to the jury. Photos on exhibit 205 published to the jury. Portions of exhibits 206, 209, and 210 played to the jury.
Exhibits 75, 76, 205 (portion shown), 209-210 (portions played), and 213-224 received.  
Court instructed the jury. Jurors excused for the morning. Jury out of the box at the hour of 11:57am. Case adjourned for continuation of jury trial on 06/10/2015 at1:15 pm in Branch 10.

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial proceeded continued. Jury back in the box at 1:23pm. Testimony continued from previously sworn State's witness, City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Todd Fischer. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Kenneth Walkowiak, City of Milwaukee Police Department Detectives Robert Laloggia and Scott Schmitz, City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Joshua Yang. Jury out of box at 1:53pm. Jury in box at 2:12pm. Sworn for the state: Citizen witnesses Diean P., Deborah P., and City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Timothy Graham.Exhibits 26, 29, 29a, 30, 30a, 82-91, 94, 96, 98-127 published to the jury. Exhibits 16, 18-23, 26, 27, 29, 29a, 30, 30a, 31-50, 52-62, 82-127 received. Court instructed the jury. Jurors excused for the day. Jury out of the box at the hour of 4:41pm. Sidebars placed on the record. Court ordered case adjourned to 06/10/2015 at 9:15am for continuation of jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant Malik M Garner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Malik M Garner in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial resumed. Sworn for the state: Citizen witness Corvette H., City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Todd Fischer. Exhibits 1-5 published to the jury. Exhibits 1-11 received. Court instructed the jury. Jurors excused for the morning at 11:58am. Jury out of the box. Case adjourned to 06/09/2015 at 1:15 in Branch 10.

Jury sworn.  Court gives preliminary instructions to the jury.  Opening statements made by Attorneys Antoni Apollo and Doug Bihler.  Jury out of the box at 4:34p.m.  Case adjourned to 6-9-2015 at 9:00 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.
